name: Coworking Spaces in Sao Paulo
description:
About Sao Paulo
Much like the cupuaçu (cacao) fruit, this formidable megacity of 20 million has a tough outer layer that is unbreakable without the force of a hammer. A shambled infrastructure, constant traffic, air pollution, violent crime, and extreme poverty makes for understandable wariness about moving to São Paulo. But once chipped away, many come to love this multicultural hub of South America – grievances, contradictions, and all.

São Paulo is ideal for having the benefits of a metropolis at your fingertips while getting to take part in the relaxed yet vibrant Brazilian lifestyle. The sprawling concrete jungle has incredibe pockets of beauty, activity, and diversity, and though the disparity between classes is obvious, paulistanos are known for their optimism and passion for life, however it’s lived. Though it’s often bypassed on the tourist track for Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo has some of Brazil’s best world-class restaurants, cultural and entertainment attractions, and gratifying stumbled-upon finds.

For the digital nomad, it doesn’t hurt that São Paulo is the largest financial center in all of South America with the most powerful startup ecosystem. And with an emergent middle class, the market size continues to grow. Today the city hosts innumerable entrepreneurship and tech events and has the largest number of cafes and coworking spaces to hustle from in Brazil. Google even jumped into the mix and established one of its first six global campuses here in late 2015. With all the enthusiasm and opportunity surrounding the startup culture, this hub is as hot and addictive as doughy coxinhas fresh from the frying pan.

Much like Rio, the hoops of the rental process can be an incredible headache, amplified further by outrageous accommodation costs. A major reason for the high cost of living in São Paulo in particular is the lack of middle ground rental options. Expatriates tend to live in a limited number of expensive neighborhoods in the south and west zones of the city that have higher security and better infrastructure. Because of the hellish traffic, people choose to live close to their work, so properties near corporate hubs are significantly pricier. As a nomad, you’ll have more living flexibility, but all the other nomads do too, which can make for a widely dispersed entrepreneur community. Make sure you scope out your hub options before diving into this fascinating monster of a city

Find the best coworker community for you by clicking on our interactive map and exploring São Paulo's coworking spaces.

name: Coworking Space: Pixels Coworking in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Pixels Coworking
For us, coworking is not a workspace.
For us, coworking is a verb.
A daily practice.

We create our own model, which inspires us to build daily a space to develop our essence:
Community + innovation + music

# 1 Community
We are a group of people joining forces for the same goal, whether simple or complex.
We optimize resources, have different and complementary views and opinions, and count on each other in difficulties and times of celebration.
We bring the sense of collectivity inside and outside our space, we cultivate good relations in Moema and surroundings with focus on the sustainability of the region.

# 2 Innovation
Innovation for us is to get out of the automatic mode of life.
Stop, breathe and think about what we do and why we do it.
Bring different looks and construct new meanings because we understand that the world today is a complex system and we want to make it different from what has already been done.

Align our lifestyle with what we really need and want to build in the future.

# 3 Music
Everything we do involves music.
We use music as a medium and not as an end, we live and work with soundtrack, we gather for a good jam session or just with a setlist to liven up the crowd.
We leave the stage open for all those who want to experiment and give a straw of their musical gifts, here anyone has place to manifest their artistic side.

Located in Brazil’s biggest city Sao Paulo, home to more than 11 million people. Pixels coworking is situated in the southern district of Moema. Close to many local bus stop’s and a Bike Sampa bicycle station, where you can easily rent a bicycle and explore the city.

This cosy open plan coworking space features many shared work desks, high-speed Internet, free coffee and water. A meeting room that can be hired out by the hour perfect for hosting your next business meeting or workshop.

name: Coworking Space: Locus Santo Andre in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Locus Santo Andre
Created in 2017 as an expansion step by the coworking conglomerate "Locus", Locus Santo Andre opened to meet the demands of customers seeking more options and privileged locations in Sao Paulo. Aiming to provide immediate solutions with low cost and risk to companies, professionals and entrepreneurs, Locus Santo Andre oozes the same sophistication and functionality as its sister properties dotted throughout Sao Paulo. Encouraging and supporting entrepreneurship as a way of life and a way to achieve personal and financial fulfillment, Locus know that it is hard to start out.

Locus Santo Andre has modern facilities and easy access to all regions of the Greater ABC. With the coworking structure, auditoriums, meeting rooms and full-time offices, the Locus Santo Andre offers a great option for the entrepreneurs of the region.

Here you will find coworking spaces where you can spread your wings, you will be able to create a virtual office, rent a private office and take advantage of the meeting rooms on offer. Having your office here will increase your professional image and business credibility. The space is relaxed and friendly with plenty of opportunities to showoff your networking skills on a daily basis. You will have everything you need to get your work done from speedy Internet to printing facilities for when you want to see words on paper. There is a telephone in each shared workstation and plenty of coffee to keep the brain waves happening. Check out their website for the coworking membership rates as they are affordable and flexible giving you the choice of joining for an hour, a day, a week, a month or even a year.

Fully furnished commercial offices have all the advantages of a physical office, without having to face the overhead expenses. Locus takes care of everything from reception services to cleaning, photo copying and stationery so that you can focus on your work or project. Comfy offices range in size and include administrative support such as reception and telephone service, cleaning, stationery, post office and printing facilities.

The creation of a virtual office will allow you to work from wherever you wish to and give you the services of a remote secretary with personalized and exclusive service, as well as a fiscal address to use. Coworking membership fees for a virtual office are varied and it would be wise to check out their website to find out which one suits you.

Fully equipped meeting rooms can be hired by the hour for business presentations, workshops or lectures and they are private with easy access.

The Sao Paulo Square Vila Olimpia Center occupies the fourth floor of the 18-storey Continental Square office tower in the heart of Vila Olimpia. This is a prestigious and thriving area, home to the Brazilian offices of leading global businesses, particularly from the IT sector. The glass, aluminum and granite high-rise is part of a multi-use complex that includes a five-hotel and convention center, exclusive spa and gymnasium, restaurant and retail area. It is close to the Faria Lima central business district and prosperous Jardins neighborhood. The center is within walking distance of banks, the Vila Olimpia Mall and other facilities. This location is easy to reach from north and south and conveniently placed for main highways and public transport systems, including a train station a kilometer away. There is 24-hour access to the center, which is protected by CCTV and has its own secure parking on two basement levels.

name: Coworking Space: Spark Coworking in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Spark Coworking
A coworking space sitting in a privileged location close to shopping malls for those into trashing credit cards during work breaks and funky restaurants plus bars for those after work entanglements, Spark Coworking is in Anália Franco, Sao Paolo. It is easily accessible via public transport as you will be only moments from both the Tatuapé and Belém subways.

The doors are open from 8am to 8pm Monday to Friday with the weekends all yours to get up to mischief. Spark Coworking is where professional freelancers, startups, entrepreneurs and even students gather to get some work done in a friendly and buzzing enclave.

Membership fees are flexible and won't send your bank balance spiralling into the red, as you will only pay for what you use. You can choose from a hot desk in a shared space to a private room or a private office that can accommodate a team of up to 8 people. There is free flowing tea and coffee to keep your brain hydrated and lockers to stash your personal goodies in.

You will have high speed internet to keep you connected, office supplies on hand in case you forgot your pen, printing facilities on hand for when you want to see words on paper and for long-term members you will have the use of a business address.

Coworking at Spark will give you perks such as a kitchen where you can whip up a snack when the hunger pangs attack, a backup system and plenty of cohorts to mingle and collaborate with.

After work, explore the shops and restaurants on Rua Purpurina, or treat the team to a show at Instituto Brincante. You will get to huddle with professionals from different areas such as local professional freelancers, startups, entrepreneurs, web marketers and designers to architects and engineers. With their belief in that sharing is the best way to realise dreams, Wit Working is an enclave for collaborating, creating and sharing ideas in a collective space of helping each other.

You will become a part of a professional community of driven individuals with office support on hand such as secretarial services. The perfect coworking space for professionals to work and network, Works Place 242 unites individuals from diverse areas and fields where ideas and experiences can be exchanged. A collaborative enclave, it is managed by one of the most awarded digital business consultancies in Brazil giving superb professional service for entrepreneurs in the new digital era.

Unique services are on offer such as advisory mentoring, coaching and workshops, bringing knowledge to professionals who want to develop their careers plus creating new business or improving initiatives. Sitting in a small modern building, the vibe is cozy. Contemporary architecture and large outdoor areas give it an inspiring feel where professionals can focus totally on their projects or work.

You will have a dedicated coworking station that is quiet, clean and ergonomically designed to suit the needs of an executive or entrepreneur. If you are chasing a private room, there are flexible enclaves suitable for both everyday work or to hold small business meetings. There is consultative mentoring with immersive analysis in the market specifics of its business modelling with tactical and strategic planning and management support for coworkers that need a helping hand. You will have all the infrastructure that you require to get your stuff done, your project finished or to make your business flourish. From cleaning fairies to a receptionist, super fast Wi-Fi and your own telephone; it is all included in your monthly fee. Coworking members will have their own workstation complete with independent power points, telephone, wired Internet and a locker to stash your personal goodies in safely.

For coworking members that opt for a private room, you will be able to accommodate up to 10 people in comfort and be able to take advantage of the common areas such as the kitchen for when the hunger pangs strike, the meeting room for private chats with clients or cohorts as well as reception and telephone services. You will have 24-hour access 7 days a week and there are special fee arrangements for those looking for a space for more than 6 months. The meeting room offers a refined atmosphere with marble table and up to 8 chairs, a 42 inch smart TV with Skype camera and broadband Internet, air conditioning and a support sofa. Mako Coworking will also look after feeding your guests if you are feeling generous.

For those chasing a virtual office scenario, Mako Coworking can help you out at a reasonable rate that will include all of the necessary services, not just a fiscal address.

"Test day - a free day to know the place, the environment of harmony and union, the biodiversity of the coworkers and their businesses, the values in the real essence of collaboration as a true office must be, including personally meeting the owner and being part of a new family."

"If you are home working alone, away from everything and everyone, here is the blue ocean of the network."

description:

Smart, contemporary and urban in style, it is a "plug and play" enclave offering private office space where you will save money by reducing business costs in a shared economy and increase your efficiency as you only have to focus on your work; the day-to-day hassles of running an office are all looked after for you.

Attracting a diverse crowd from professional freelancers to startups and entrepreneurs as well as businesses, its community is dynamic and innovative. You will have super fast Internet to connect to plus all of the office gadgets that you could possibly need on hand. There are 2 modern meeting rooms that are fully equipped (think video conferencing, TV and a blackboard to scribble on) for when you want to have a private chat with a client or a brainstorming session with team players. Training rooms are available for workshops and the common areas give you the space to have impromptu chats with cohorts, slurp on coffee or to vegetate when the brain is about to implode. The auditoriums are located in the Av. Paulista area near the metro with easy on-site parking and a capacity of up to 100 people. Coworking spaces vary from private rooms that can hold up to 4 people or large spaces that can accommodate up to 8 individuals. There are 4 stunning balconies to give you somewhere to run to for a breath of fresh air or a quiet contemplative moment in your own bubble.

If you wish to create a virtual office, VIP can look after it for you by providing all of the services that you will need.

description:

Our space is located in the heart of the Vila Madalena neighborhood, and offers all the conditions and support services for your project. Lets reveal new ideas and better ways of working and living, building together a place capable of enabling them.

description:

Sharing the same premises, it gives an extra depth for exchanging ideas, experiences and knowledge generating synergies for new projects, clients and suppliers.

A world of creativity and collaboration, coworking at Umb.co23 has membership plans to suit different needs from using the premises as a business address only, the occasional use of the meeting room or a fixed workstation in a shared office enclave.

It is a coworking world enhanced by its likeminded members from a diverse range of industries where you can foster ideas and possibilities or merely moan about the mistakes of everyday life, if that is your mood.

For those looking for a virtual office, the services include that of a secretary who will look after your telephone needs and receive correspondence on your behalf, for much less cost than a traditional secretary. The meeting room at Umb.co23 will hold up to 8 people in comfort or up to 15 in audiotorium format and is equipped with air-conditioning, fast wifi to plug into, a projector and plenty of complimentary drinking water to keep brains hydrated, as well as coffee for the caffeine addicts.

description:

A corporate coworking space catering to all sizes of companies from freelancers to multinationals, Estudio Capanema has private or shared rooms in Jardins, Itaim and Campo Belo as well as a coworking office in São Paulo. Predominantly it is a world of focused individuals in their 30s to their 45s that gather and huddle at Estudio Capanema all from a diverse range of backgrounds and industries creating a rich and enterprising dynamic space.

Focusing on helping businesses to grow, their motto is "to think big and be innovative". Membership plans are all inclusive so you will have no nasty surprises to send you crying to the bank at the end of each month.

Coworking stations come complete with speedy wifi, modern office furniture, meeting rooms for when you need a tete-a-tete or brain storming session and plenty of free parking. The caffeine addicts have been taken care of with heaps of fresh and hot coffee virtually on tap. Meeting rooms are pseudo home living rooms with a home theater available. The entire space is quiet, clean and ergonomic to bring out the best of you in your work.

If you need your own private office space, they are located in the heart of the best neighborhoods close to cafes, restaurants and commercial centers with plenty of public transport available. Each coworking office is well thought out with plenty of power outlets to recharge your gadgets.

There is internal TV circuit security with access control at the entrance, so you never have to worry about the bogeyman getting to your belongings. There are 2 sizes of work desk to choose from, drawers and lockers to stash your personal goodies in and a terrace to swan on when you need a breath of fresh air. There are secretarial services on hand to help with day-to-day dramas, clients, correspondence and meetings if need be.

description:

Founded in 2014, BUCC Work Spaces in Sao Paulo is a business unlocking and collaboration center for the coworking entrepreneur, startup or small business looking to share experiences or to grow and transform ideas into reality.

Some recent reviews on BUCC Work Spaces:

"Amazing environment, varied options of space, well solved common areas - as a large integrated garden - and super well located - there is a nearby train station - university city, bicycle track on the avenue in front of the house, near the pan square, shopping Villa-Lobos and Avenue Faria Lima."

"Tops. Excellent commercial environment in a very nice and green space."

"A place with an amazing and cozy decor. Service that surpasses expectations and a great location too."

BUCC is the acronym for Business Unlocking & Collaboration Center - business empowerment through a collaborative culture. This is where you can cowork as much or as little as you like, network with likeminded souls and let your ideas soar beyond your wildest imagination with a little help from your coworking cohorts. Relationships are fluid, the mentality is digital and there is a dynamic vibe permeating the venue.

You will find meeting rooms, private rooms, shared coworking spaces plus a private garden to mooch around when work gets too much and a cafe to swan around. For the really serious chill-out times, there is the Breeze Spa to indulge your body and soul.

Spaces are created with growth in mind no matter how large you grow if you are a startup and they are fully serviced. There is dedicated link plug and play Internet, all the necessary office gadgets you could need to play on including printing facilities for when you want to see words on paper. The on-site crew is bilingual so you won't have lost in translation moments if you need to call on their assistance. The cleaning fairies come in every night to ensure that the paper missile that missed the rubbish bin is picked up and for those without their own 4 wheels, there are plenty of bicycle racks to chain your bike to.

Also available is an auditorium, meeting rooms and training rooms, as well as a coffee shop and a great terrace and gardens, with an amazing view to São Paulo's most important landmark.

It is easily accessible via public transport and offers convenience, practicality and a lot of security.

Created with the objective of offering a flexible, safe, comfortable and highly functional space to stimulate and support the region's burgeoning gung ho souls involved in innovation and entrepreneurship, it attracts a diverse crowd to its doors from all walks of businesses. Think startups to professional freelancers, wandering nomads with laptops in tow as well as small businesses. Its coworking community is dynamic, creative and collaborative. There is no bureaucracy and no hassles about running an office on a day-to-day basis, as it is all taken care of for you.

Coworking membership plans are affordable as you can join by the day, the week or the month; whatever suits your work habits. You will have super fast Wi-Fi to connect to, a personal locker to stash your goodies in, a business address and of course, oodles of coffee to keep the caffeine addicts smiling all day. You can choose from the open workspace or a private room, if you want to float around in your own bubble of creativity.

Your coworking membership will include a number of hours of complimentary use of the meeting room for when you need a brainstorming session with team players or a client chat. It is fully equipped with a smart TV, chromecast, a flip chart and air conditioning.

Sitting near the Square Open Mall where you have everything from banking to dry cleaners, cafes and shops, it is easily accessible via public transport and there is convenient parking for those with their own 4 wheels.

Attracting a diverse crowd of workers to its doors from a wide range of business disciplines, this is where you can be independent and yet be a part of a dynamic community of innovative souls. From wandering nomads with laptops in tow to entrepreneurs, startups and small businesses, the community is interactive, collaborative and engaging.

Coworking membership fees are affordable and flexible to suit any budget without you having to worry about whether you can afford your dinner of seafood stew. You can grab a seat at a shared desk, plug into super fast Wi-Fi, have a private telephone and a business address.

For those that may be lacking in skills, there is professional coaching on hand and if you happen to be a caffeine addict, the complimentary coffee is non-stop all day.

description:

Sitting in a quiet street in Jundiai close to City Hall and only 1 km from the heart of the city, Sharing Offices is easily accessible via public transport and has plenty of parking for those with their own 4 wheels. This is where you can forget about the hassles of running your office from making sure there is ink in the printer to toilet paper in the loo, as everything is taken care of so that you can concentrate on your project or work.

Sharing Office is the perfect place to indulge in some networking with the dynamic cohorts that you will be surrounded by. From solo freelancers to entrepreneurs, startups and their teams to small businesses, it is a dynamic and innovative workspace. It is all about cooperation, interaction and connecting with likeminded people.
There are no long lease contracts, no initial investment and plenty of scope to work how and when you want to.

A professional environment, coworking at Sharing Offices will give you super fast Wi-Fi to connect to, reception services, a multifunctional printer to play on and you can get comfy at either a hot desk or a fixed desk. description:
Overview of OSHI Swiss Park

Oshi Swiss Park offers furnished coworking spaces, meeting rooms and a Virtual Office scenario, if that is what you wish to set up. Its dynamic community of likeminded souls include, wandering nomads with laptops in tow, professional local freelancers, startups and entrepreneurs as well as businesses to its doors that are open 24/7. There are plenty of opportunities to network with your cohorts on a daily basis over a cup of coffee.

Coworking services include access to a virtual secretary who will look after your customers, arrange meetings on your behalf or whatever else you may need to be done, especially if you decide to go on a holiday. You will have multimedia equipment at no extra cost from a flipchart to a blackboard, plus a projector to play with. The meeting rooms are decked out in swish style and are fully equipped with the necessary gadgets and equipment to ensure everything runs smoothly. It is the perfect space for workshops, lectures or presentation moments.

There are flexible coworking fee options to choose from, so that you can work how and when you want to. The costs will leave you plenty of cash left over to buy you and your dog dinner. There are membership plans for a solo coworker and plans available if you need space for a team or for a horde of employees. It is possible to adjust the number you are catering for if your business needs to downsize or upsize.

You will get to focus on your work or project, whilst Oshi's fantastic and friendly staff takes care of the rest. There are reception services on hand to serve you in a discrete and professional manner and the super fast and high capacity Wi-Fi is secure and will keep you connected, so that there are no unexpected surprises or disruptions.

There is also plenty of coffee to keep the brain waves buzzing.

This is where working and family is not compartmentalized.

The venue is easily accessible, as it is only 500 meters from Santa Cruz subway station and there are plenty of buses to get you there running on the Rua Domingos de Morais line. The children's space is carefully set out so that they can play and develop fully and safely with separate areas for different ages from babies to toddlers. Cubo was born out of a three-pronged collaboration from Pripas, the São Paulo-based Internet entrepreneur and CEO of Bitinvest; Brazil's largest bank, Itaú Unibanco; and Redpoint e.ventures—a partnership between Menlo Park-headquartered Redpoint Ventures and San Francisco's e.ventures.

 It marks the kickstart of an innovative and collaborative ecosystem of the entreprenuerial market in Latin America. It's a haven for everything that happens in the Brazilian startups world - and trust us its a piece of action you want to be a part of.

As a 5,000m² space in Vila Olimpia, you get 3-stories of co-working area, 1 floor dedicated entirely to workshops and training and an amphitheater fit for 130 people. And of course a rooftop and terrace lounge - the only legit way to enjoy Brazilian coffee!

They offer mentorships and entrepreneurial education for digital start-ups and entrepreneurs who need a little nudge to take their ideas further.

 Needless to say, it's deffo a (huge) space worth checking out if you're into these kinda stuff and as they always say in the startup world "you put a bunch of like-minded smart people in a room and just wait for the BOOM' Okay well we totally made that up but you gota' agree.
